ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[((Î”iâ€‹W)2âˆ’Î”n)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=0,\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\left((\Delta_{i}W)^{2}-\Delta_{n}\right)\Delta_{i}M\right]=0,

which implies that ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=0\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\Delta_{i}M\right]=0. Thus, for any p,q>0p,q>0 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2, by orthogonality between MM and WW, we have

mnâ€‹|âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹Ïƒtiâˆ’12â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]|\displaystyle\sqrt{m_{n}}\left|\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\sigma^{2}_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}M\right]\right|
=mnâ€‹|âˆ’âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹Ïƒtiâˆ’12â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµi|â‰¥vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]|\displaystyle\quad=\sqrt{m_{n}}\left|-\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\sigma^{2}_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\geq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}M\right]\right|
â‰¤mnâ€‹vnâˆ’1â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹W|2â€‹|xi+Îµi|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]\displaystyle\quad\leq\sqrt{m_{n}}v_{n}^{-1}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{2}|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}||\Delta_{i}M|\right]
â‰¤mnâ€‹vnâˆ’1â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹W|2â€‹p]1/pâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|xi+Îµi|q]1/qâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹M|2]1/2\displaystyle\quad\leq\sqrt{m_{n}}v_{n}^{-1}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{2p}\right]^{1/p}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|^{q}\right]^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\right]^{1/2}
â‰¤mnâ€‹vnâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹W|2â€‹p]2/pâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|xi+Îµi|q]2/q)1/2\displaystyle\quad\leq\sqrt{m_{n}}v_{n}^{-1}\left(\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{2p}\right]^{2/p}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|^{q}\right]^{2/q}\right)^{1/2}
Ã—(âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹M|2])1/2\displaystyle\qquad\times\left(\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\right]\right)^{1/2}
â‰²mnâ€‹vnâˆ’1â€‹(nâ€‹Î”n2â€‹Î”n2/q)1/2Ã—(1mn1/2â€‹Î”n1/2)\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\sqrt{m_{n}}v_{n}^{-1}\left(n\Delta_{n}^{2}\Delta_{n}^{2/q}\right)^{1/2}\times\Big(\frac{1}{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}\Big) (92)
â‰¤(mnâ€‹Î”n)1/2â€‹Î”n1/qâ€‹vnâˆ’1Ã—(1mn1/2â€‹Î”n1/2)=Î”n1/qâ€‹vnâˆ’1,\displaystyle\quad\leq(m_{n}\Delta_{n})^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/q}v_{n}^{-1}\times\Big(\frac{1}{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}\Big)=\Delta_{n}^{1/q}v_{n}^{-1},

which vanishes by taking qq close enough to 2 and pp large enough given that vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} with Î²<1/2\beta<1/2. â™¢\diamondsuit

Proof of (33).

Recall that (Î”iâ€‹X)2=xi2+2â€‹xiâ€‹Îµi+Îµi2.(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}=x_{i}^{2}+2x_{i}\varepsilon_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}^{2}. We analyze ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹((xi+2â€‹xiâ€‹Îµi+Îµi2)â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹B)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big((x_{i}+2x_{i}\varepsilon_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}^{2})\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}B\big) term by term. For the third term, by Cauchy-Schwarz and (57), we have

supi|ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(Îµi2â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹B)|â‰¤supi(ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹Îµi4â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹B2)1/2=OPâ€‹(Î”n3/2)â€‹(Î”n1/2)=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\displaystyle\sup_{i}{|\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(\varepsilon_{i}^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}B\big)|}\leq\sup_{i}\big(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\varepsilon_{i}^{4}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\Delta_{i}B^{2}\big)^{1/2}=O_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2})(\Delta_{n}^{1/2})=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). (93)

For the second term, similar to (A.2), when |Îµi|>vn|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}, by Markovâ€™s inequality and (57), we can obtain that

Pâ€‹(|Îµi|>vn)â‰¤Kâ€‹Î”n1+(1/2âˆ’Î²)â€‹rP(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n})\leq K\Delta_{n}^{1+(1/2-\beta)r}

for all r>0r>0. By Holderâ€™s inequality, for p1,p2,p3>1p_{1},p_{2},p_{3}>1 such that âˆ‘i=131/pi=1\sum_{i=1}^{3}1/p_{i}=1, we may write

supi|ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(Îµiâ€‹xiâ€‹ğŸ|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vn,|Îµi|>vnâ€‹Î”iâ€‹B)|â‰¤supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹|Îµip1|1/p1â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹|xip2â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vn}|1/p2â€‹Pâ€‹(|Îµi|>vn)1/p3.\displaystyle\sup_{i}|\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big({\varepsilon_{i}x_{i}}\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n},|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}}\Delta_{i}B\big)|\leq\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}|\varepsilon_{i}^{p_{1}}|^{1/p_{1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}|x_{i}^{p_{2}}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n}\}}|^{1/p_{2}}P(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n})^{1/p_{3}}.

As all the quantities on the right hand side are bounded but Pâ€‹(|Îµi|>vn)P(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}) vanishes faster than any fixed power of Î”n\Delta_{n}. By taking large enough rr, we can obtain

supi|ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Îµiâ€‹xi|â€‹ğŸ|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vn,|Îµi|>vnâ€‹Î”iâ€‹B)|=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\sup_{i}|\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\varepsilon_{i}x_{i}|\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n},{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}}}\Delta_{i}B\big)|=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}).

Then what remains for the second term is the case that |Îµi|â‰¤vn|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}. Since |Îµi|â‰¤vn|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n} and |Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vn|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n} implies |xi|â‰¤2â€‹vn|x_{i}|\leq 2v_{n}. By Cauchy-Schwarz, we obtain

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Îµiâ€‹xi|â€‹ğŸ{|xi|â‰¤2â€‹vn}â€‹ğŸ{|Îµi|â‰¤vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹B|]â‰¤\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\varepsilon_{i}x_{i}|\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq 2v_{n}\}}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}B|\right]\leq supi(ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Îµi2â€‹xi2â€‹ğŸ{|xi|â‰¤2â€‹vn}]â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹B)2])1/2\displaystyle\sup_{i}\Big(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\varepsilon_{i}^{2}x_{i}^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq 2v_{n}\}}\right]\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}B)^{2}\right]\Big)^{1/2}
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq OPâ€‹(Î”n3/4)â€‹OPâ€‹(Î”n1/2)â€‹Î”n1/2=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2),\displaystyle O_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/4})O_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{1/2})\Delta_{n}^{1/2}=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}), (94)

Then what remains is the first term involving xi2x_{i}^{2}. We aim to show

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[xi2â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹B]=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[x_{i}^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}B\right]=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). (95)

We start by replacing xi2x_{i}^{2} with (Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹W)2(\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W)^{2}. Note that when |Î”iâ€‹W|>vn|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n} or |Îµi|>vn|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}, by HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality, and that Pâ€‹(|Îµi|>vn)P(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}) and Pâ€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn)P(|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}) decay faster than any power of Î”n\Delta_{n} since Î”n1/2/vnâ‰ªÎ”n1/2âˆ’Î²\Delta_{n}^{1/2}/v_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/2-\beta}, using similar techniques as in (89) and the boundness of Ïƒ\sigma, we obtain

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹B|â€‹(ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn}+ğŸ{|Îµi|>vn})]=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\sigma_{t_{i-1}}(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}B|\left(\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}\}}+\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}\}}\right)\right]=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). (96)

And further notice that when |Î”iâ€‹W|â‰¤vn|\Delta_{i}W|\leq v_{n} and Îµiâ‰¤vn\varepsilon_{i}\leq v_{n}, |xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n} imples |Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n} for some positive constant CC that we assume for simplicity is 11. Then equivalently, we may write

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹Bâ€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹W|â‰¤vn}â€‹ğŸ{|Îµi|â‰¤vn}]\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\sigma_{t_{i-1}}(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}B\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}W|\leq v_{n}\}}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}\right]
=\displaystyle= supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹B]\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\sigma_{t_{i-1}}(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}B\right]
=\displaystyle= supiÏƒtiâˆ’1â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹Î”iâ€‹B]â€‹Pâ€‹(|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vn).\displaystyle\sup_{i}\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\Delta_{i}B]P(|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}). (97)

Then it suffices to show supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹Î”iâ€‹B]=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2)\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\Delta_{i}B]=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). Similar to how we handle the second term in (A.2), recall Ïs=dâ€‹âŸ¨W,BâŸ©s/dâ€‹s\rho_{s}=d\langle W,B\rangle_{s}/ds. By ItÃ´â€™s Lemma, Cauchy-Schwarz inequality, and Doobâ€™s inequality, we have

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹Î”iâ€‹B]â‰²Î”n3/2â€‹supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(Ïtiâˆ’Ïtiâˆ’1)2.\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}\Delta_{i}B]\lesssim\Delta_{n}^{3/2}\sup_{i}\sqrt{\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(\rho_{t_{i}}-\rho_{t_{i-1}})^{2}}.

Since Ï\rho is right-continuous and uniformly bounded on [0,1][0,1], ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(Ïtiâˆ’Ïtiâˆ’1)2â†’0\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(\rho_{t_{i}}-\rho_{t_{i-1}})^{2}\rightarrow 0 and (95) holds with xi2=Ïƒtiâˆ’12â€‹(Î”iâ€‹W)2x_{i}^{2}=\sigma_{t_{i-1}}^{2}(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}.

Now replace xi2x_{i}^{2} with (Î”iâ€‹J)2(\Delta_{i}J)^{2} in (95). We need to show

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµ|â‰¤vn}â€‹Î”iâ€‹B]=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon|\leq v_{n}\}}\Delta_{i}B\right]=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). (98)

Note that when |Î”iâ€‹W|>vn|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n} or |Îµi|>vn|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}, by HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality, and that Pâ€‹(|Îµi|>vn)P(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}) and Pâ€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn)P(|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}) decay faster than any power of Î”n\Delta_{n} since Î”n1/2/vnâ‰ªÎ”n1/2âˆ’Î²\Delta_{n}^{1/2}/v_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/2-\beta}, by similar techniques as in (89), we obtain

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹B|â€‹(ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn}+ğŸ{|Îµi|>vn})]=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}B|\left(\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}\}}+\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}\}}\right)\right]=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). (99)

And further notice that when |Î”iâ€‹W|â‰¤vn|\Delta_{i}W|\leq v_{n} and Îµiâ‰¤vn\varepsilon_{i}\leq v_{n}, |xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n} imples |Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n} for some positive constant CC that we assume for simplicity is 11. Then by Holder inequality and Lemma 17 in [3], for any p,q>1p,q>1 such that 1/p+1/q=11/p+1/q=1, we obtain

supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹B|]\displaystyle\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}B|\right] â‰¤supiğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹pâ€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vn}]1/pâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹Wq|]1/q\displaystyle\leq\sup_{i}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2p}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}\}}\big]^{1/p}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big[|\Delta_{i}W^{q}|\big]^{1/q}
â‰²(Î”nâ€‹vn2â€‹pâˆ’Y)1/pâ€‹Î”n1/2.\displaystyle\lesssim(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y})^{1/p}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}. (100)

By making pp close to 1 and q large, the above bound is of order oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2)o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}).

What remains to show is to replace xi2x_{i}^{2} with Î”iâ€‹Wâ€‹Î”iâ€‹J\Delta_{i}W\Delta_{i}J in (95). Similar to the case for (Î”iâ€‹J)2(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}. By HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality, and that Pâ€‹(|Îµi|>vn)P(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}) and Pâ€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn)P(|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}) decay faster than any power of Î”n\Delta_{n} since Î”n1/2/vnâ‰ªÎ”n1/2âˆ’Î²\Delta_{n}^{1/2}/v_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/2-\beta}, with similar techniques as in (89), we obtain

supiÏƒtiâˆ’1â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹J|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹W|â€‹ğŸ{|xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹B|â€‹(ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn}+ğŸ{|Îµi|>vn})]=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\displaystyle\sup_{i}\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}J||\Delta_{i}W|\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}B|\left(\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}\}}+\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}\}}\right)\right]=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). (101)

And further notice that when |Î”iâ€‹W|â‰¤vn|\Delta_{i}W|\leq v_{n} and Îµiâ‰¤vn\varepsilon_{i}\leq v_{n}, |xi+Îµi|â‰¤vn|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n} imples |Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n} for some positive constant CC that we assume for simplicity is 11. Then by Holder inequality and Lemma 17 in [3], for any p,q>1p,q>1 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2, we obtain

supiÏƒtiâˆ’1â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹J|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹W|â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹B|]\displaystyle\sup_{i}\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}J||\Delta_{i}W|\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}B|\right] â‰¤supiÏƒtiâˆ’1â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vn}]1/2â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹Wq|]1/qâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹Bq|]1/q\displaystyle\leq\sup_{i}\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}\}}\big]^{1/2}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big[|\Delta_{i}W^{q}|\big]^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big[|\Delta_{i}B^{q}|\big]^{1/q}
â‰²(Î”nâ€‹vn2âˆ’Y)1/2â€‹Î”n=oPâ€‹(Î”n3/2).\displaystyle\lesssim(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2-Y})^{1/2}\Delta_{n}=o_{P}(\Delta_{n}^{3/2}). (102)

Then we have proved (33) and Z2âŸ‚Z1Z_{2}\perp Z_{1}. â™¢\diamondsuit

A.3 Proof of technical limits in Theorem 2

Proof of (37).

It suffices to prove the following two terms:

A1:=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹X)2â€‹ğŸ{vnâ‰¤|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1),A_{1}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{v_{n}\leq|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1),

and

A2:=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹X)2â€‹ğŸ{Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)â‰¤|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1).A_{2}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta})\leq|\Delta_{i}X|\leq\zeta v_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1).

Firstly we work on A1A_{1}. By Cauchy-Schwarz and Proposition 1, we obtain:

|A1|\displaystyle|A_{1}| â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹X)4â€‹ğŸ{vnâ‰¤|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)}]12â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{4}\mathbf{1}_{\{v_{n}\leq|\Delta_{i}X|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vn4âˆ’Yâ€‹vnÎ·)12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{4-Y}v_{n}^{\eta}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}. (103)

Since MM is square integrable, it yields âˆ‘i=1n(Î”iâ€‹M)2=OPâ€‹(1)\sum_{i=1}^{n}(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}=O_{P}(1). Then we find:

âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12â‰¤\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\leq (âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”n2â€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„))1/2â€‹(âˆ‘i=1n(Î”iâ€‹M)2)1/2\displaystyle\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}K^{2}_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\Big)^{1/2}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\Big)^{1/2}
â‰²\displaystyle\lesssim 1mnâ€‹Î”n.\displaystyle\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}. (104)

Along with mnâ‰ªÎ”nâˆ’1m_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{-1} and the boundedness of KK, we conclude that

|A1|â‰²1Î”n1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹vnÎ·2=vnÎ·2=oPâ€‹(1).|A_{1}|\lesssim\frac{1}{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}v_{n}^{\frac{\eta}{2}}=v_{n}^{\frac{\eta}{2}}=o_{P}(1).

A similar argument shows that A2=oPâ€‹(1)A_{2}=o_{P}(1). â™¢\diamondsuit

Proof of (38).

For convenience, we rewrite (38) here:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹X)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (105)

The proof follows along the lines of the proof of an analogous identity in [3] (see Lemma 7 and Eq.Â (D.10) in the supplemental material of [4] posted online). More specifically, it was proved there in that

1vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹X)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{1}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (106)

Note that (105) does not directly follow from (106) and the boundedness of KK because mnâ€‹Î”nâ†’0m_{n}\Delta_{n}\to{}0. So, we need to account for the localizing effect of the kernel, for which we applied some different bounds.

Using the notation introduced in (A), consider the decomposition

(Î”iâ€‹X)2=(xi+Îµi)2=xi2+2â€‹xiâ€‹Îµi+Îµi2.(\Delta_{i}X)^{2}=(x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i})^{2}=x_{i}^{2}+2x_{i}\varepsilon_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}^{2}.

We begin by analyzing the second and third terms on the right-hand side by Cauchy-Schwarz. In particular, applying (57), we obtain that

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Îµi2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\varepsilon_{i}^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)|\Delta_{i}M|\right]
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Îµi4]12â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\varepsilon_{i}^{4}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n32â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12=oPâ€‹(1),\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}=o_{P}(1),

since, by (A.3), âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12â‰²1mnâ€‹Î”n\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\lesssim\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}} and, recalling that vnâ‰«Î”n1/2v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{1/2},

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n3/2â€‹1mnâ€‹Î”n=Î”nâ€‹vnY/2âˆ’2â‰ªÎ”nY/4â‰ª1.\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{Y/2-2}\ll\Delta_{n}^{Y/4}\ll 1.

For the term involving xiâ€‹Îµix_{i}\varepsilon_{i}, note that when |Îµi|>vn|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}, by Lemma 3 in [4], for some constant K>0K>0, we have

Piâˆ’1â€‹(|Îµi|>vn)â‰¤ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Îµi|r]vnrâ‰¤Kâ€‹Î”n1+râ€‹(12âˆ’Î²),\displaystyle P_{i-1}(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n})\leq\frac{\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[|\varepsilon_{i}|^{r}]}{v_{n}^{r}}\leq K\Delta_{n}^{1+r\left(\frac{1}{2}-\beta\right)}, (107)

which holds for sufficiently large rr due to (57) and vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta}. Similar to (A.2), using HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality and Proposition 1, we conclude that:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Îµiâ€‹xi|â€‹ğŸ{|xi|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|â€‹ğŸ{|Îµi|>vn}]=oPâ€‹(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\varepsilon_{i}x_{i}|\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}\}}\right]=o_{P}(1).

When |Îµi|â‰¤vn|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}, observe that |Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vn|\Delta_{i}X|\leq\zeta v_{n} implies |xi|=|Î”iXâˆ’Îµi|â‰¤(1+Î¶)vn=:Cvn|x_{i}|=|\Delta_{i}X-\varepsilon_{i}|\leq(1+\zeta)v_{n}=:Cv_{n}. Then, by Proposition 3 in [4], (57), and (A.3), we get:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Îµiâ€‹xi|â€‹ğŸ{|xi|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\varepsilon_{i}x_{i}|\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Îµi4]14â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[xi4â€‹ğŸ{|xi|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}]14â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\varepsilon_{i}^{4}\right]^{\frac{1}{4}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[x_{i}^{4}\mathbf{1}_{\{|x_{i}|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{4}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n34â€‹Î”n12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{4}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n34â€‹Î”n12â€‹1mnâ€‹Î”n=Î”n34â€‹vnY/2âˆ’2â‰ªÎ”nYâˆ’14â‰ª1,\displaystyle=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{4}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{4}}v_{n}^{Y/2-2}\ll\Delta_{n}^{\frac{Y-1}{4}}\ll 1,

since Î”n1/2â‰ªvn\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ll v_{n} and Y>1Y>1.

Then we just need to focus on the last term involving xi2x_{i}^{2}. We need to show that

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[xi2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[x_{i}^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (108)

Letâ€™s start by replacing xix_{i} with btiâˆ’1â€‹Î”nb_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n} in (108) with arbitrary MM. By the boundedness of KK, bb and Cauchy-Schwarz, we have

mn1/2â€‹Î”n2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[btiâˆ’12â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[b_{t_{i-1}}^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]
â‰²mn1/2â€‹Î”n2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹mnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]1/2\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}\Delta_{n}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{1/2}
â‰²mn1/2â€‹Î”n3/2vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹mnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2])1/2\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}\Delta_{n}}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]\Big)^{1/2}
â‰²Î”n1/2vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vnY/2â†’0\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{Y/2}}\rightarrow 0 (109)

which the last line follows from mnâ‰«Î”nâˆ’1â€‹vnÎ³m_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{-1}v_{n}^{\gamma} with Î³<Y\gamma<Y and vnâ‰«Î”n1/2v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{1/2}. Besides, recall that x^i=Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹W+Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J\hat{x}_{i}=\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W+\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J and by applying Cauchy-Schwarz twice and boundness of KK, we obtain

mn1/2â€‹Î”nÎ”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[btiâˆ’1â€‹x^iâ€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[b_{t_{i-1}}\hat{x}_{i}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]
â‰²mn1/2â€‹Î”nÎ”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹mnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2])1/2â€‹(âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[x^i2â€‹fn2â€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)])1/2\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}\Delta_{n}}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]\Big)^{1/2}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\hat{x}_{i}^{2}f_{n}^{2}(\Delta_{i}X)\right]\Big)^{1/2}
â‰²Î”n1/2vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹mn1/2â‰²Î”n1/2vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vnY/2â†’0,\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}m_{n}^{1/2}}\lesssim\frac{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{Y/2}}\rightarrow 0, (110)

where the last line follows from mnâ‰«Î”nâˆ’1â€‹vnÎ³m_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{-1}v_{n}^{\gamma} with Î³<Y\gamma<Y and vnâ‰«Î”n1/2v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{1/2}.

Now we just need to work on the case that xi=x^i=Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹W+Î”iâ€‹Jx_{i}=\hat{x}_{i}=\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W+\Delta_{i}J. We first prove this for M=WM=W. Replacing xix_{i} with Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹W\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W in (108), for any q,p>1q,p>1 such that 1q+1p=1\frac{1}{q}+\frac{1}{p}=1, we obtain:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹|âˆ‘i=1nÏƒtiâˆ’12â€‹Kmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]|\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left|\sum_{i=1}^{n}\sigma_{t_{i-1}}^{2}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]\right|
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹W|3â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹X|>vn}]\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{3}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}X|>v_{n}\}}\right]
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)3â€‹p]1pâ€‹Piâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹X|>vn]1q\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{3p}\right]^{\frac{1}{p}}P_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}X|>v_{n}\right]^{\frac{1}{q}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nâˆ’1â€‹Î”n32â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’Y)1q,\displaystyle\quad\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{-1}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{3}{2}}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{\frac{1}{q}}, (111)

where we used Lemma 2 in [4] and HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality in the third line. Notice that

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n1/2â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’Y)1qâ‰ªvnâˆ’2+Y/2â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’Y)1q.\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{\frac{1}{q}}\ll v_{n}^{-2+Y/2}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{\frac{1}{q}}.

Moreover, since 34+Y>12\frac{3}{4+Y}>\frac{1}{2}, we have

Î”n3/2â€‹vnâˆ’4+Y2â‰ª1â‡”Î”n3/(4+Y)â‰ªvn.\Delta_{n}^{3/2}v_{n}^{-\frac{4+Y}{2}}\ll 1\quad\Leftrightarrow\quad\Delta_{n}^{3/(4+Y)}\ll v_{n}.

Then (A.3) vanishes by taking qq close to 1.

Now, replacing xix_{i} with Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J with M=WM=W, we need to show that:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹|Î”iâ€‹W|]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)|\Delta_{i}W|\right]=o_{P}(1). (112)

When |Î”iâ€‹W|>vn|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n} or |Îµi|>vn|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}, recall (107) that Pâ€‹(|Îµi|>vn)P(|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}) and Pâ€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn)P(|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}) both decay faster than any power of Î”n\Delta_{n}. By HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality, we can derive:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹|Î”iâ€‹W|â€‹(ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹W|>vn}+ğŸ{|Îµi|>vn})]=oPâ€‹(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)|\Delta_{i}W|(\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}\}}+\mathbf{1}_{\{|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}\}})\right]=o_{P}(1).

Thus, when |Î”iâ€‹W|â‰¤vn|\Delta_{i}W|\leq v_{n}, |Îµi|â‰¤vn|\varepsilon_{i}|\leq v_{n}, and |Î”iâ€‹X|=|xi+Îµi|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vn|\Delta_{i}X|=|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\leq\zeta v_{n}, we have |Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n} for some constant CC. Therefore, for (112) to hold, it suffices to show that:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹W|]â€‹â†’ğ‘ƒâ€‹0.\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}W|\right]\overset{P}{\to}0.

Using HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality and Lemma 17 in [3], for any p,q>1p,q>1 such that 1p+1q=1\frac{1}{p}+\frac{1}{q}=1, we have:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹pâ€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤2â€‹vn}]1pâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹W|q]1q\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2p}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq 2v_{n}\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{p}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{q}\right]^{\frac{1}{q}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vn2â€‹pâˆ’Y)1pâ€‹Î”n1/2.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}.

Thus, by taking pp very close to 1 (and qq very large), we get convergence to 0 since

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vn2âˆ’Y)â€‹Î”n1/2â‰²vnY/2âˆ’2â€‹vn2âˆ’Yâ€‹Î”n1/2â†’0,\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2-Y}\right)\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\lesssim v_{n}^{Y/2-2}v_{n}^{2-Y}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\rightarrow 0,

which is due to Î”n1/Yâ‰ªÎ”n1/2â‰ªvn\Delta_{n}^{1/Y}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ \ll v_{n}.

Now, we prove (108) for any bounded martingale MM orthogonal to WW. The cross-product term when expanding xi2x_{i}^{2} can be analyzed similarly by assuming |Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}. To this end, we need to show that:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹J|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹W|â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}J||\Delta_{i}W|\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1).

Using HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality and (A.3), for any p,q>2p,q>2 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2 we conclude that:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹J|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹W|â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}J||\Delta_{i}W|\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]
â‰¤\displaystyle\leq mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)pâ€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}]1pâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹W)q]1qâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2]12\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{{p}}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\right]^{\frac{1}{p}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}W)^{{q}}\right]^{\frac{1}{{q}}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²\displaystyle\lesssim mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnpâˆ’Y)1/pâ€‹Î”n1/2â€‹1mnâ€‹Î”n=(Î”nâ€‹vnpâˆ’Y)1/pvn2âˆ’Y/2,\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{p-Y})^{1/p}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{p-Y})^{1/p}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}, (113)

which vanishes by taking pp close to 2 since

(Î”nâ€‹vn2âˆ’Y)1/2vn2âˆ’Y/2=Î”n1/2â€‹vnâˆ’1â‰ªÎ”n1/2âˆ’Î²â‰ª1.\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2-Y})^{1/2}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}=\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{-1}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/2-\beta}\ll 1.

Next we consider the case when xix_{i} is replaced with Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹W\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W. Since fnâ€‹(x)â‰¤ğŸ|Î”iâ€‹X|â‰¥vnf_{n}(x)\leq\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}X|\geq v_{n}}, it suffices to show

Dn:=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹W|2â€‹ğŸ{|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1).D_{n}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{2}\mathbf{1}_{\{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq Cv_{n}\}}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1).

Notice that |Î”iâ€‹X|=|xi+Îµi|â‰¥vn|\Delta_{i}X|=|x_{i}+\varepsilon_{i}|\geq v_{n} implies that either |Î”iâ€‹W|>vn/3|\Delta_{i}W|>v_{n}/3, |Îµi|>vn/3|\varepsilon_{i}|>v_{n}/3 or |Î”iâ€‹J|>vn/3|{\Delta_{i}J}|>v_{n}/3. The first two cases are straightforward as the tails decay faster than any power of Î”n\Delta_{n}. For the remaining case we utilize HÃ¶lderâ€™s inequality. For any p>0p>0, q>0q>0 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2, we obtain

Dn\displaystyle D_{n} â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹W|2â€‹p]1/p\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}W|^{2p}\right]^{1/p}
Ã—â„™iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹J|>vn/3]1/qâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹M|2]1/2\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{P}_{i-1}\left[{|\Delta_{i}J|>v_{n}/3}\right]^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\right]^{1/2}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nâ€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’Y)1/qâ€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[|Î”iâ€‹M|2]1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/q}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\right]^{1/2}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nâ€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’Y)1/qâ€‹1mnâ€‹Î”n=1Î”n1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nâ€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’Y)1/q,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/q}\frac{1}{\sqrt{m_{n}}\Delta_{n}}=\frac{1}{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/q},

where we used (A.3). Using vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} and taking qq close to 2 from above, the above equation vanishes since

1Î”n1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nâ€‹(Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’Y)1/2=Î”nâ€‹vnâˆ’2â‰ª1.\frac{1}{\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-Y})^{1/2}=\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{-2}\ll 1.

Finally, we consider the case where xix_{i} is replaced with Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J in (108). It requires to show:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (114)

Note that

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹|fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)âˆ’fnâ€‹(Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J)|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1),\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right||\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1), (115)

which is shown at the end of the appendix. Hence it suffices to prove:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\Delta_{i}M\right]=o_{P}(1). (116)

In what follows, we assume Ï‡=1\chi=1; the general case follows from analogous arguments. Hereafter, we assume that the following LÃ©vyâ€“ItÃ´ decomposition for J{J}:

Jt=âˆ«0tâˆ«xâ€‹ğŸ{|x|â‰¤1}â€‹NÂ¯â€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x)+âˆ«0tâˆ«xâ€‹ğŸ{|x|>1}â€‹Nâ€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x),J_{t}={\int_{0}^{t}\int{x\mathbf{1}_{\{|x|\leq 1\}}}\bar{N}(ds,dx)+\int_{0}^{t}\int{x\mathbf{1}_{\{|x|>1\}}}N(ds,dx)},

where NÂ¯â€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x)=Nâ€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x)âˆ’Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹dâ€‹s\bar{N}(ds,dx)=N(ds,dx)-\nu(dx)ds is the compensated jump measure of JJ. Additionally, similar to expression (80) in [1], MM admits the decomposition:

Mt=Mtâ€²+âˆ«0tâˆ«Î´â€‹(s,x)â€‹NÂ¯â€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x),M_{t}=M^{\prime}_{t}+\int_{0}^{t}\int\delta(s,x)\bar{N}(ds,dx),

where Mâ€²M^{\prime} is a martingale orthogonal to both WW and NN, and Î´\delta is a bounded function satisfying:

E[âˆ«tuâˆ«Î´2(s,x)Î½(dx)ds|â„±t]â‰¤E[(Muâˆ’Mt)2|â„±t]<âˆ.E\left[\int_{t}^{u}\int\delta^{2}(s,x)\nu(dx)ds\middle|\mathcal{F}_{t}\right]\leq E\left[(M_{u}-M_{t})^{2}\middle|\mathcal{F}_{t}\right]<\infty.

For future reference, define Niâ€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x):=Nâ€‹(ti+dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x)N^{i}(ds,dx):=N(t_{i}+ds,dx), Î´iâ€‹(s,x):=Î´â€‹(ti+s,x)\delta_{i}(s,x):=\delta(t_{i}+s,x), and:

pnâ€‹(x)=x2â€‹fnâ€‹(x),tnâ€‹(y,x)=pnâ€‹(x+y)âˆ’pnâ€‹(y),wnâ€‹(y,x)=pnâ€‹(x+y)âˆ’pnâ€‹(y)âˆ’xâ€‹pnâ€²â€‹(y)â€‹ğŸ{|x|â‰¤1}.p_{n}(x)=x^{2}f_{n}(x),\quad t_{n}(y,x)=p_{n}(x+y)-p_{n}(y),\quad w_{n}(y,x)=p_{n}(x+y)-p_{n}(y)-xp^{\prime}_{n}(y)\mathbf{1}_{\{|x|\leq 1\}}.

Applying ItÃ´â€™s formula to Yuiâˆ’1:=Ltiâˆ’1+uâˆ’Ltiâˆ’1Y_{u}^{i-1}:=L_{t_{i-1}+u}-L_{t_{i-1}}, we obtain:

pnâ€‹(Yuiâˆ’1)=\displaystyle p_{n}(Y_{u}^{i-1})= âˆ«0upnâ€²â€‹(Ysâˆ’iâˆ’1)â€‹ğ‘‘Ysiâˆ’1+âˆ«0uâˆ«(pnâ€‹(Ysâˆ’iâˆ’1+x)âˆ’pnâ€‹(Ysâˆ’iâˆ’1)âˆ’pnâ€²â€‹(Ysâˆ’iâˆ’1)â€‹x)â€‹Niâˆ’1â€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x)\displaystyle\int_{0}^{u}p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s^{-}}^{i-1})dY_{s}^{i-1}+\int_{0}^{u}\int\left(p_{n}(Y_{s^{-}}^{i-1}+x)-p_{n}(Y_{s^{-}}^{i-1})-p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s-}^{i-1})x\right)N^{i-1}(ds,dx)
=\displaystyle= âˆ«0uâˆ«|x|â‰¤1pnâ€²â€‹(Ysâˆ’iâˆ’1)â€‹xâ€‹NÂ¯iâˆ’1â€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x)+âˆ«0uâˆ«wnâ€‹(Ysâˆ’iâˆ’1,x)â€‹Niâˆ’1â€‹(dâ€‹s,dâ€‹x).\displaystyle\int_{0}^{u}\int_{|x|\leq 1}p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s-}^{i-1})x\bar{N}^{i-1}(ds,dx)+\int_{0}^{u}\int w_{n}(Y_{s-}^{i-1},x)N^{i-1}(ds,dx). (117)

Now, let Zuiâˆ’1:=Mtiâˆ’1+uâˆ’Mtiâˆ’1Z_{u}^{i-1}:=M_{t_{i-1}+u}-M_{t_{i-1}}. Applying ItÃ´â€™s formula to pnâ€‹(Yuiâˆ’1)â€‹Zuiâˆ’1p_{n}(Y_{u}^{i-1})Z_{u}^{i-1}, we get:

pnâ€‹(Yuiâˆ’1)â€‹Zuiâˆ’1\displaystyle p_{n}(Y_{u}^{i-1})Z_{u}^{i-1} =âˆ«0upnâ€‹(Ysiâˆ’1)â€‹ğ‘‘Zsiâˆ’1+âˆ«0uZsiâˆ’1â€‹dâ€‹(pnâ€‹(Ysiâˆ’1))+âˆ‘sâ‰¤uÎ”â€‹(pnâ€‹(Ysiâˆ’1))â€‹Î”â€‹Zsiâˆ’1\displaystyle=\int_{0}^{u}p_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1})dZ_{s}^{i-1}+\int_{0}^{u}Z_{s}^{i-1}d\left(p_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1})\right)+\sum_{s\leq u}\Delta(p_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1}))\Delta Z_{s}^{i-1}
=Mrtg+âˆ«0uâˆ«Î´iâ€‹(s,x)â€‹tnâ€‹(Ysiâˆ’1,x)â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s+âˆ«0uâˆ«wnâ€‹(Ysiâˆ’1,x)â€‹Zsiâˆ’1â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s,\displaystyle={\text{Mrtg}}+\int_{0}^{u}\int\delta_{i}(s,x)t_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1},x)\nu(dx)ds+\int_{0}^{u}\int w_{n}(Y_{s}^{i-1},x)Z_{s}^{i-1}\nu(dx)ds, (118)

where Mrtg denotes the martingale part generated from the ItÃ´â€™s formula. Fixing u=Î”nu=\Delta_{n} in (A.3) and taking expectations, we obtain:

ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[pnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹J)â€‹Î”iâ€‹M]=\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[p_{n}(\Delta_{i}J)\Delta_{i}M\right]= ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«Î´iâ€‹(s,x)â€‹tnâ€‹(Ys,x)â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int\delta_{i}(s,x)t_{n}(Y_{s},x)\nu(dx)ds\right]
+ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«wnâ€‹(Ys,x)â€‹Zsâ€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s].\displaystyle+\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int w_{n}(Y_{s},x)Z_{s}\nu(dx)ds\right]. (119)

In the above equation, we omit the superscript iâˆ’1i-1 in YY and ZZ for simplicity. For the second term in (A.3), we use the following bound (see (D.22) and (D.23) in [4]):

ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|wnâ€‹(Ys,x)|â€‹|Zs|â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]â‰¤Kâ€‹(vn2âˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)âˆ¨vn)â€‹Î”nâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|)+Kâ€‹vn2âˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)â€‹Î”n2â€‹vnÎ·âˆ’Y.\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|w_{n}(Y_{s},x)||Z_{s}|\nu(dx)ds\right]\leq K(v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\vee v_{n})\Delta_{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|)+Kv_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{\eta-Y}.

Combining the above equation with the second term in (A.3) and plugging it back in (116), we need to show the negligibility of the two terms below:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(vn2âˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)âˆ¨vn)â€‹Î”nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\vee v_{n}\right)\Delta_{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|)
+mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)â€‹Î”n2â€‹vnÎ·âˆ’Yâ€‹Î”nâˆ’1.\displaystyle\quad+\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{\eta-Y}\Delta_{n}^{-1}. (120)

The first term converges to 0 since vnY/2âˆ’2â€‹vn2âˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)â€‹Î”n1/2â‰ª1v_{n}^{Y/2-2}v_{n}^{2-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ll 1 and vnY/2âˆ’2â€‹vnâ€‹Î”n1/2â‰ª1v_{n}^{Y/2-2}v_{n}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\ll 1 with Y>1Y>1 if Î·\eta is small enough and

Î”n1/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|)\displaystyle\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|)
â‰¤(Î”nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”n2â€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„))1/2â€‹(âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|2))1/2=OPâ€‹(mnâˆ’1/2â€‹Î”nâˆ’1/2).\displaystyle\leq\Big(\Delta_{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K^{2}_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\Big)^{1/2}\Big(\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})\Big)^{1/2}=O_{P}(m_{n}^{-1/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}).

The second term in (120) if of order mn1/2â€‹vnâˆ’3â€‹Y/2+(1âˆ’Y)â€‹Î·â€‹Î”n3/2m_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{-3Y/2+(1-Y)\eta}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}, which vanishes by taking Î·\eta small enough due to the condition mnâ‰ªÎ”nâˆ’5â€‹vn8+Ym_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{-5}v_{n}^{8+Y}, since Î”nâˆ’5â€‹vn8+Yâ‰ªvn3â€‹Yâ€‹Î”nâˆ’3\Delta_{n}^{-5}v_{n}^{8+Y}\ll v_{n}^{3Y}\Delta_{n}^{-3} with vnâ‰ªÎ”n1/(4âˆ’Y)v_{n}\ll\Delta_{n}^{1/(4-Y)}. Thus, the two terms in (120) converge to zero, and we conclude that:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|wnâ€‹(Ys,x)|â€‹|Zs|â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s)=oPâ€‹(1).\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|w_{n}(Y_{s},x)||Z_{s}|\nu(dx)ds\right)=o_{P}(1).

It remains to show that the contribution of the first term in (A.3) is negligible:

Fn:=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)â€‹tnâ€‹(Ys,x)â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]=oPâ€‹(1).F_{n}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int\delta_{i-1}(s,x)t_{n}(Y_{s},x)\nu(dx)ds\right]=o_{P}(1).

As in (D.25) in [4], we separately consider the cases where |Ys|â‰¤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}, |Ys|>Î¶â€‹vn|Y_{s}|>\zeta v_{n}, vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)<|Ys|<Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}), vnâ‰¤|Ys|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}), and Î¶â€‹vnâ‰¤|Ys|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)\zeta v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq\zeta v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}).

First, suppose that |Ys|â‰¤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}, so that fnâ€‹(Ys)=0f_{n}(Y_{s})=0, and thus tnâ€‹(Ys,x)=(Ys+x)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Ys+x)t_{n}(Y_{s},x)=(Y_{s}+x)^{2}f_{n}(Y_{s}+x), with |x|â‰¥13â€‹vn1+Î·|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta} (otherwise fnâ€‹(Ys+x)=0f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)=0). Notice that |tnâ€‹(Ys,x)|â‰¤Ys2+2â€‹|xâ€‹Ys|+x2|t_{n}(Y_{s},x)|\leq Y_{s}^{2}+2|xY_{s}|+x^{2}. For Ys2Y_{s}^{2}, using Cauchy-Schwarz and the bound

ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[Ys2â€‹kâ€‹1{|Ys|â‰¤vn}]â‰¤Kâ€‹Î”nâ€‹vn2â€‹kâˆ’Y,\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[Y_{s}^{2k}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}\right]\leq K\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2k-Y}, (121)

valid for all 0<s<Î”n0<s<\Delta_{n} (see Lemma 12 in [4]),

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹Ys2â€‹1{|Ys|â‰¤vn}â€‹1{|x|â‰¥13â€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|Y_{s}^{2}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right)
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«Ys4â€‹1{|Ys|â‰¤vn}â€‹1{|x|â‰¥13â€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s)12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int Y_{s}^{4}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s)12\displaystyle\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(vnâˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)â€‹Î”n2â€‹vn4âˆ’Y)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}(v_{n}^{-Y(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{4-Y})^{1/2}
Ã—âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”n(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)ğ”¼iâˆ’1(âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´(u,x)|2Î½(dx)du)12\displaystyle\qquad\times\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(u,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)du\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2â€‹Î”n3/2â€‹vnâˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹((Î”iâ€‹M)2)12\displaystyle\lesssim m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{3/2}v_{n}^{-Y(1+\eta)/2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left((\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²Î”n1/2â€‹vnâˆ’Yâ€‹(1+Î·)/2,\displaystyle\lesssim\Delta_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{-Y(1+\eta)/2}, (122)

where the last line follows from âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹((Î”iâ€‹M)2)12=OPâ€‹(mnâˆ’1/2â€‹Î”nâˆ’1)\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left((\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}=O_{P}(m_{n}^{-1/2}\Delta_{n}^{-1}) (see (A.3)) and Î”nâ€‹mnâ‰ª1\Delta_{n}m_{n}\ll 1. The bound (122) tends to zero under our assumption vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} with small enough Î·\eta. Next, we focus on 2â€‹Ysâ€‹x2Y_{s}x. Using again (121) and Cauchy-Schwarz,

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹|Ysâ€‹x|â€‹1{|Ys|â‰¤vn}â€‹1{|x|â‰¥13â€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)||Y_{s}x|1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s)12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«Ys2â€‹x2â€‹1{|Ys|â‰¤vn}â€‹1{|x|â‰¥13â€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s)12\displaystyle\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int Y_{s}^{2}x^{2}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(Î”n2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y)12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´â€‹(u,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘u]12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{2-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(u,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)du\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹(ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2])12=Î”n12â€‹vnâˆ’1â€‹OPâ€‹(1),\displaystyle=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}}\Delta_{n}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}\right]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}=\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}v_{n}^{-1}O_{P}(1), (123)

which again is oPâ€‹(1)o_{P}(1) since vnâ‰«Î”n12v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}.

It remains to analyze the term corresponding to x2x^{2}. First, since |Ys+x|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vn|Y_{s}+x|\leq\zeta v_{n} when fnâ€‹(Ys+x)>0f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)>0, we have |x|â‰¤(1+Î¶)vn=:Cvn|x|\leq(1+\zeta)v_{n}=:Cv_{n} due to our assumption |Ys|â‰¤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}. Then, for any sequence Î±n>0\alpha_{n}>0 such that Î±nâ†’0\alpha_{n}\to 0,

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â‰¤Î±n|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹x2â€‹1{|x|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|x^{2}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|x|â‰¤Câ€‹vnx4â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|x|\leq Cv_{n}}x^{4}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â‰¤Î±n|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vn4âˆ’Y)12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´â€‹(s,x)|â‰¤Î±n|Î´â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{4-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{1/2}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vn4âˆ’Y)12â€‹[âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”n2â€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)]1/2â€‹[âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´â€‹(s,x)|â‰¤Î±n|Î´â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]]1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{4-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\Big[\sum_{i=1}^{n}K^{2}_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\Big]^{1/2}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\Big[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\Big]\right]^{1/2}
â‰²mn1/2â€‹Î”nâ€‹[mnâˆ’1â€‹Î”nâˆ’2]1/2â€‹[âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´â€‹(s,x)|â‰¤Î±n|Î´â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]]1/2=oPâ€‹(1),\displaystyle\lesssim m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}[m_{n}^{-1}\Delta_{n}^{-2}]^{1/2}{\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\Big[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\Big]\right]^{1/2}}=o_{P}(1), (124)

since as Î±nâ†’0\alpha_{n}\to 0,

ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ‘i=1nğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´â€‹(s,x)|â‰¤Î±n|Î´â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s)]=ğ”¼â€‹[âˆ«0Tâˆ«|Î´â€‹(s,x)|â‰¤Î±n|Î´â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]â†’0.\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left(\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right)\right]=\mathbb{E}\left[\int_{0}^{T}\int_{|\delta(s,x)|\leq\alpha_{n}}|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]\to 0.

On the complementary region, we proceed as follows:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|>Î±n|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹x2â€‹1{|x|â‰¤Câ€‹vn}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|>\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|x^{2}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰¤CÎ±nâ€‹mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹vn2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|>Î±n|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\leq\frac{C}{\alpha_{n}}\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|>\alpha_{n}}|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰¤CÎ±nâ€‹mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹vn2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\leq\frac{C}{\alpha_{n}}\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰²CÎ±nâ€‹mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹vn2â€‹1mnâ€‹Î”n=vnY2Î±nâ€‹mn1/2â€‹Î”n1/2,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{C}{\alpha_{n}}\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\frac{1}{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}=\frac{v_{n}^{\frac{Y}{2}}}{\alpha_{n}m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}, (125)

which is oPâ€‹(1)o_{P}(1) under our assumption mnâ€‹Î”nâ‰«vnÎ³m_{n}\Delta_{n}\gg v_{n}^{\gamma} with Î³<Y\gamma<Y, since vnY2Î±nâ€‹mn1/2â€‹Î”n1/2â‰ªvnYâˆ’Î³2Î±n\frac{v_{n}^{\frac{Y}{2}}}{\alpha_{n}m_{n}^{1/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}}\ll\frac{v_{n}^{\frac{Y-\gamma}{2}}}{\alpha_{n}} and we can take Î±nâ†’0\alpha_{n}\to 0 such that vn(Yâˆ’Î³)/2Î±nâ†’0\frac{v_{n}^{(Y-\gamma)/2}}{\alpha_{n}}\to 0. The proof for the negligibility of FnF_{n} in the case |Ys|â‰¤vn|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n} is complete.

For the case of |Ys|â‰¥Î¶â€‹vn|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}, we have fnâ€‹(Ys)=0f_{n}(Y_{s})=0 and tnâ€‹(Ys,x)=(Ys+x)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Ys+x)â‰¤(Î¶â€‹vn)2t_{n}(Y_{s},x)=(Y_{s}+x)^{2}f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)\leq(\zeta v_{n})^{2}. We observe that when fnâ€‹(Ys+x)>0f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)>0, we have |Ys+x|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’13â€‹vnÎ·)|Y_{s}+x|\leq\zeta v_{n}(1-\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{\eta}), implying |x|>Î¶â€‹vn1+Î·/3|x|>\zeta v_{n}^{1+\eta}/3. We then can write that

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹(Ys+x)2â€‹fnâ€‹(Ys+x)â€‹1{|Ys|â‰¥Î¶â€‹vn}â€‹1{|x|â‰¥Câ€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|(Y_{s}+x)^{2}f_{n}(Y_{s}+x)1_{\{|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹vn2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«1{|Ys|â‰¥Î¶â€‹vn}â€‹1{|x|â‰¥Câ€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int 1_{\{|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}\}}1_{\{|x|\geq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹vn2â€‹(Î”n2â€‹vnâˆ’Yâˆ’(1+Î·)â€‹Y)12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«tiâˆ’1tiâˆ«|Î´â€‹(u,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘u]12â‰²(A.3)Î”n12â€‹vnâˆ’(1+Î·)â€‹Y2,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}v_{n}^{2}\left(\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{-Y-(1+\eta)Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{t_{i-1}}^{t_{i}}\int|\delta(u,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)du\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}\stackrel{{\scriptstyle\eqref{kernel_sqrt_m}}}{{\lesssim}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}v_{n}^{-\frac{(1+\eta)Y}{2}},

which vanishes by taking small Î·>0\eta>0 due to vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta}. We have then proved the negligibility of FnF_{n} in the case |Ys|â‰¥Î¶â€‹vn|Y_{s}|\geq\zeta v_{n}.

For the case when vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)<|Ys|<Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}), when |x|â‰¥13â€‹vn1+Î·|x|\geq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}, we can use the bound |tnâ€‹(Ys,x)|â‰¤Câ€‹vn2|t_{n}(Y_{s},x)|\leq Cv_{n}^{2} and follow a similar proof as in (E.27). When |x|â‰¤13â€‹vn1+Î·|x|\leq\frac{1}{3}v_{n}^{1+\eta}, fnâ€‹(x+Ys)=1=fâ€‹(Ys)f_{n}(x+Y_{s})=1=f(Y_{s}), implying tnâ€‹(Ys,x)=x2+2â€‹xâ€‹Yst_{n}(Y_{s},x)=x^{2}+2xY_{s}. We consider the contribution of each term separately below. For the case of x2x^{2}, we have:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹x2â€‹1vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)<|Ys|<Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)â€‹1{|x|â‰¤Câ€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|x^{2}1_{v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta})}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12â€‹Eiâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«x4â€‹1{|Ys|â‰¥vn}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}E_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int x^{4}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\geq v_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(vn(4âˆ’Y)â€‹(1+Î·)â€‹Î”n2â€‹vnâˆ’Y)12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹(Eiâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2])12â‰²vnÎ·â€‹(4âˆ’Y)âˆ’Y2â€‹Î”n12â‰ª1,\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(v_{n}^{(4-Y)(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(E_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\lesssim v_{n}^{\frac{\eta(4-Y)-Y}{2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}\ll 1,

for all Î·>0\eta>0, where the last line follows from (A.3). For the term corresponding to 2â€‹|xâ€‹Ys|2|xY_{s}|, since |Ys|<Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}), for some CC,

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹|xâ€‹Ys|â€‹1vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)<|Ys|<Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)â€‹1{|x|â‰¤Câ€‹vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)||xY_{s}|1_{v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta})}1_{\{|x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«x2â€‹Ys2â€‹1{|Ys|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vn}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int x^{2}Y_{s}^{2}1_{\{|Y_{s}|\leq\zeta v_{n}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹(vn(2âˆ’Y)â€‹(1+Î·)â€‹Î”n2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y)12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹(ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2])12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\left(v_{n}^{(2-Y)(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{2-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
=vnâˆ’Y2+Î·â€‹(2âˆ’Y)2â€‹Î”n12â€‹OPâ€‹(1)=oPâ€‹(1),\displaystyle=v_{n}^{-\frac{Y}{2}+\frac{\eta(2-Y)}{2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}O_{P}(1)=o_{P}(1), (126)

where again the last line follows from (A.3) for all Î·>0\eta>0. This proves the negligibility of FnF_{n} for the case vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)<|Ys|<Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})<|Y_{s}|<\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta}).

The only cases left are when vnâ‰¤|Ys|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}) and Î¶â€‹vnâ‰¤|Ys|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)\zeta v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq\zeta v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta}). It suffices to consider the first case as the other case is proved similarly. If |x|â‰¥vn1+Î·|x|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}, consider the same argument as in (D.26) in [4] and suppose that |x|â‰¤vn1+Î·|x|\leq v_{n}^{1+\eta}. Note that |pnâ€²â€‹(y)|â‰¤2â€‹|yâ€‹fnâ€‹(y)|+|y2â€‹fnâ€²â€‹(y)|â‰¤Câ€‹vn1âˆ’Î·|p^{\prime}_{n}(y)|\leq 2|yf_{n}(y)|+|y^{2}f^{\prime}_{n}(y)|\leq Cv_{n}^{1-\eta} when |y|â‰¤Câ€‹vn|y|\leq Cv_{n}. Consequently, |tnâ€‹(Ys,x)|â‰¤|pnâ€²â€‹(Ys,x)|â€‹|x|â‰¤Câ€‹vn1âˆ’Î·â€‹|x||t_{n}(Y_{s},x)|\leq|p^{\prime}_{n}(Y_{s},x)||x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1-\eta}|x|. Thus, FnF_{n} is bounded by

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn1âˆ’Î·â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|â€‹|x|â€‹1{vnâ‰¤|Ys|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)}â€‹1{|x|â‰¤vn1+Î·}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}}v_{n}^{1-\eta}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)||x|1_{\{v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\}}1_{\{|x|\leq v_{n}^{1+\eta}\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn1âˆ’Î·â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|Î´iâˆ’1â€‹(s,x)|2â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}}v_{n}^{1-\eta}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int|\delta_{i-1}(s,x)|^{2}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
Ã—ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[âˆ«0Î”nâˆ«|x|â‰¤Câ€‹vn1+Î·x2â€‹1{vnâ‰¤|Ys|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)}â€‹Î½â€‹(dâ€‹x)â€‹ğ‘‘s]12\displaystyle\qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\times\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[\int_{0}^{\Delta_{n}}\int_{|x|\leq Cv_{n}^{1+\eta}}x^{2}1_{\{v_{n}\leq|Y_{s}|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\}}\nu(dx)ds\right]^{\frac{1}{2}}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn1âˆ’Î·â€‹(vn(2âˆ’Y)â€‹(1+Î·)â€‹Î”n2â€‹vnÎ·âˆ’Y)12â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹(ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹M)2])12\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}}v_{n}^{1-\eta}\left(v_{n}^{(2-Y)(1+\eta)}\Delta_{n}^{2}v_{n}^{\eta-Y}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\left(\mathbb{E}_{i-1}[(\Delta_{i}M)^{2}]\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}
=vnâˆ’Y2+Î·â€‹(1âˆ’Y)2â€‹Î”n12â€‹OPâ€‹(1),\displaystyle=v_{n}^{-\frac{Y}{2}+\frac{\eta(1-Y)}{2}}\Delta_{n}^{\frac{1}{2}}O_{P}(1), (127)

where we used (D.24) in [4] and (A.3). By taking Î·\eta small enough, it follows that the above expression is oPâ€‹(1)o_{P}(1). This concludes the proof. â™¢\diamondsuit

Proof of (115).

We start by noting that

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ|Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J|>4â€‹Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹|fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)âˆ’fnâ€‹(Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J)|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|>4\zeta v_{n}}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right||\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1). (128)

Indeed, note that

ğŸ|Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J|>4â€‹Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹|fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)âˆ’fnâ€‹(Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J)|\displaystyle\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|>4\zeta v_{n}}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right| â‰¤ğŸ|Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J|>4â€‹Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)â‰¤ğŸ|btiâˆ’1â€‹Î”n+Ïƒtiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹W+Îµi|>3â€‹Î¶â€‹vn,\displaystyle\leq\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|>4\zeta v_{n}}f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)\leq\mathbf{1}_{|b_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n}+\sigma_{t_{i-1}\Delta_{i}W}+\varepsilon_{i}|>3\zeta v_{n}}, (129)

and, thus, by HÃ¶lderâ€™s and Markovâ€™s inequalities along with vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} and (57), for large enough rr, we have:

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|â€‹(ğŸ|btiâˆ’1â€‹Î”n|>Î¶â€‹vn+ğŸ|Ïƒtiâˆ’1Î”iW|>Î¶vn+ğŸ|Îµi|>Î¶â€‹vn)]=oPâ€‹(1),\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}|\Delta_{i}M|(\mathbf{1}_{|b_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n}|>\zeta v_{n}}+\mathbf{1}_{|\sigma_{t_{i-1}\Delta_{i}W|>\zeta v_{n}}}+\mathbf{1}_{|\varepsilon_{i}|>\zeta v_{n}})\right]=o_{P}(1),

which implies (128) and (129). Consequently, it suffices to prove that

mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ|Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤4â€‹Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹|fnâ€‹(Î”iâ€‹X)âˆ’fnâ€‹(Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J)|â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1).\displaystyle\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\left|f_{n}(\Delta_{i}X)-f_{n}(\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J)\right||\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1). (130)

First, we observe that

|fnâ€‹(x+y)âˆ’fnâ€‹(y)|â‰¤ğŸ|x|â‰¥vn1+Î·/3+ğŸvnâ‰¤|y|â‰¤(1+vnÎ·)â€‹Â orÂ â€‹Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹(1âˆ’vnÎ·)â‰¤|y|â‰¤Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹|x|vn1+Î·,\displaystyle|f_{n}(x+y)-f_{n}(y)|\leq\mathbf{1}_{|x|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/3}+\mathbf{1}_{v_{n}\leq|y|\leq(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\text{ or }\zeta v_{n}(1-v_{n}^{\eta})\leq|y|\leq\zeta v_{n}}\frac{|x|}{v_{n}^{1+\eta}}, (131)

where y=Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹Jy=\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J and x=Î”iXâˆ’Ï‡tiâˆ’1Î”iJ=btiâˆ’1Î”n+Ïƒtiâˆ’1Î”iW+Îµi=:zi,1+zi,2+zi,3x=\Delta_{i}X-\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J=b_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{n}+\sigma_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}W+\varepsilon_{i}=:z_{i,1}+z_{i,2}+z_{i,3}.

We start with the first term in (131). We proceed to verify that

Bl:=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸ|Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤4â€‹Î¶â€‹vnâ€‹ğŸ|zi,l|â‰¥vn1+Î·/9â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|]=oPâ€‹(1),B_{l}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\mathbf{1}_{|z_{i,l}|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/9}|\Delta_{i}M|\right]=o_{P}(1),

for l=1,2,3l=1,2,3. Take the case l=2l=2 for instance. Assuming Ï‡=Ïƒ=1\chi=\sigma=1 for simplicity, by Holderâ€™s inequality we obtain

B2â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(Î”iâ€‹J8â€‹ğŸ|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤4â€‹Î¶â€‹vn)1/4â€‹Piâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|â‰¥vn1+Î·/9)1/4â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|2)1/2.B_{2}\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(\Delta_{i}J^{8}\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\big)^{1/4}P_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}W|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/9\big)^{1/4}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\big)^{1/2}.

Notice that for any Î±>0\alpha>0, for some constant CC, we have Piâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|â‰¥vn1+Î·/9)â‰²ğ”¼â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|Î±)/vnÎ±â€‹(1+Î·)â‰¤Î”nÎ±/vnÎ±â€‹(1+Î·)P_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}W|\geq v_{n}^{1+\eta}/9)\lesssim\mathbb{E}(|\Delta_{i}W|^{\alpha})/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)}\leq\Delta^{\alpha}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)}. Therefore, along with Proposition 1 and (A.3), we have

B2\displaystyle B_{2} â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n1/4â€‹vn(8âˆ’Y)/4â€‹Î”nÎ±/4/vnÎ±â€‹(1+Î·)/4â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|2)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/4}v_{n}^{(8-Y)/4}\Delta^{\alpha/4}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})^{1/2}
â‰²mn1/2â€‹vnY/4Î”n1/4â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”nÎ±/4/vnÎ±â€‹(1+Î·)/4.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}v_{n}^{Y/4}}{\Delta_{n}^{1/4}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta^{\alpha/4}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}.

Since vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta}, for small enough Î·>0\eta>0, 12âˆ’Î²â€‹(1+Î·)>0\frac{1}{2}-\beta(1+\eta)>0. Then by taking Î±\alpha large enough we obtain B2=oPâ€‹(1)B_{2}=o_{P}(1). B1B_{1} can be shown oPâ€‹(1)o_{P}(1) using the similar argument. For B3B_{3}, by (57)

B3\displaystyle B_{3} â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(Î”iâ€‹J8â€‹ğŸ|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤4â€‹Î¶â€‹vn)1/4â€‹ğ”¼â€‹(|Îµi|4â€‹Î±)1/4/vnÎ±â€‹(1+Î·)/4â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|2)1/2\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(\Delta_{i}J^{8}\mathbf{1}_{|\Delta_{i}J|\leq 4\zeta v_{n}}\big)^{1/4}\mathbb{E}\big(|\varepsilon_{i}|^{4\alpha}\big)^{1/4}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\big)^{1/2}
â‰¤mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2â€‹Î”n1/4â€‹vn(8âˆ’Y)/4â€‹Î”n(1+Î±/2)/4/vnÎ±â€‹(1+Î·)/4â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|2)1/2,\displaystyle\leq\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2}}\Delta_{n}^{1/4}v_{n}^{(8-Y)/4}\Delta^{(1+\alpha/2)/4}_{n}/v_{n}^{\alpha(1+\eta)/4}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2}\big)^{1/2},

which tends to zero in probability by taking Î·\eta small enough and Î±\alpha large enough similar to B2B_{2}. Next, we analyze the second term in (131). We only consider {vnâ‰¤|y|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)}\{v_{n}\leq|y|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})\} as the other case is similar. To this end, we need to show that

Cl:=mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2+1+Î·â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹[(Î”iâ€‹J)2â€‹ğŸvnâ‰¤|Ï‡tiâˆ’1â€‹Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·)â€‹|Î”iâ€‹M|â€‹|zi,l|]=oPâ€‹(1),C_{l}:=\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\left[(\Delta_{i}J)^{2}\mathbf{1}_{v_{n}\leq|\chi_{t_{i-1}}\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})}|\Delta_{i}M||z_{i,l}|\right]=o_{P}(1),

for l=1,2,3l=1,2,3. Assume for simplicity of notation that Ï‡=Ïƒ=1\chi=\sigma=1. By (A.3), Holderâ€™s inequality and Lemma 17 in [3], for any p,q>1p,q>1 such that 1/p+1/q=1/21/p+1/q=1/2,

C2\displaystyle C_{2} â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2+1+Î·â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(Î”iâ€‹J2â€‹pâ€‹ğŸvnâ‰¤|Î”iâ€‹J|â‰¤vnâ€‹(1+vnÎ·))1/pâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|q)1/qâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|2)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(\Delta_{i}J^{2p}\mathbf{1}_{v_{n}\leq|\Delta_{i}J|\leq v_{n}(1+v_{n}^{\eta})}\big)^{1/p}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}W|^{q}\big)^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})^{1/2}
â‰²mn1/2Î”nâˆ’1/2â€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2+1+Î·â€‹âˆ‘i=1nKmnâ€‹Î”nâ€‹(tiâˆ’1âˆ’Ï„)â€‹(Î”nâ€‹vn2â€‹pâˆ’Y+Î·)1/pâ€‹Î”n1/2â€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹W|q)1/qâ€‹ğ”¼iâˆ’1â€‹(|Î”iâ€‹M|2)1/2\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{m_{n}^{1/2}}{\Delta_{n}^{-1/2}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}\sum_{i=1}^{n}K_{m_{n}\Delta_{n}}(t_{i-1}-\tau)(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y+\eta})^{1/p}\Delta_{n}^{1/2}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}\big(|\Delta_{i}W|^{q}\big)^{1/q}\mathbb{E}_{i-1}(|\Delta_{i}M|^{2})^{1/2}
â‰²(Î”nâ€‹vn2â€‹pâˆ’Y+Î·)1/pvn2âˆ’Y/2+1+Î·.\displaystyle\lesssim\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y+\eta})^{1/p}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}.

Taking pp close to 22 such that 1/p=1/2âˆ’s1/p=1/2-s for some small s>0s>0, the last line has order

(Î”nâ€‹vn2â€‹pâˆ’Y+Î·)1/pvn2âˆ’Y/2+1+Î·=vn(Yâˆ’4)/2â€‹Î”n1/2âˆ’sâ€‹vn2âˆ’Y/2+Î·/2+sâ€‹(Yâˆ’Î·)=Î”n1/2âˆ’sâ€‹vnÎ·/2âˆ’1+sâ€‹(Yâˆ’Î·)â‰¤Î”n1/2âˆ’sâ€‹vnÎ·/2âˆ’1,\frac{(\Delta_{n}v_{n}^{2p-Y+\eta})^{1/p}}{v_{n}^{2-Y/2+1+\eta}}=v_{n}^{(Y-4)/2}\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s}v_{n}^{2-Y/2+\eta/2+s(Y-\eta)}=\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s}v_{n}^{\eta/2-1+s(Y-\eta)}\leq\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s}v_{n}^{\eta/2-1},

which vanishes since vnâ‰«Î”nÎ²v_{n}\gg\Delta_{n}^{\beta} and Î”n1/2âˆ’sâˆ’(1âˆ’Î·/2)â€‹Î²â‰ª1\Delta_{n}^{1/2-s-(1-\eta/2)\beta}\ll 1 given Î·\eta and ss are small enough. A similar argument works for C1C_{1} and C3C_{3} and establishes (115). â™¢\diamondsuit
